de.jcommandlineparser
Interface CmdLineParser

All Known Implementing Classes:
CmdLineParserImpl
public interface CmdLineParser

An implementation of CmdLineParser will provide command line argument parsing functionality.
Parsing logic is delegated to given Strategy

Author:
bananenkasper
See Also:
Strategy

Method Detail

registerOption

<O> void registerOption(AbstractOption<O> o)
                    throws DuplicateOptionIdentifierException
Adds a program option that will be parsed for.

Type Parameters:
O - Implementation type of Option. Could be an String option or Integer option, for instance.
Parameters:
o - The program option that is parsed for.
Throws:
DuplicateOptionIdentifierException
See Also:
AbstractOption

addStrategy

<S extends Strategy> void addStrategy(S s)
Add a (custom) Strategy for parsing. Most common parsing strategies are included by default, such as parsing strategies for expressions like this:
--key=value
--key value1 [value2] [value3] [..]
-v1[v2][v3][..]
Therefore, in most cases, there will be no need to add a further strategy.

Type Parameters:
S - Implementation type of Strategy
Parameters:
s - Strategy for parsing.
See Also:
Strategy

removeAllStrategies

void removeAllStrategies()
Removes all registered parsing strategies from CmdLineParser.

parse

java.lang.String[] parse(java.lang.String[] args)
                         throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                                NoValueExeption,
                                NoKeyException
Parse command line arguments. All given strategies will be used, to support different command line argument formating.

Parameters:
args - Array of String that is parsed.
Returns:
Remaining command line arguments, that could not be recognized.
Throws:
java.lang.NumberFormatException - Parsing a certain value has failed. e.g. Integer.parseint("foo");
NoValueExeption
NoKeyException

parse

java.lang.String[] parse(java.lang.String args)
                         throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                                NoValueExeption,
                                NoKeyException
Parse command line arguments. All given strategies will be used, to support different command line argument formating.

Parameters:
args - Single string that is parsed.
Returns:
Remaining command line arguments, that could not be recognized.
Throws:
java.lang.NumberFormatException - Parsing a certain value has failed. e.g. Integer.parseint("foo");
NoValueExeption
NoKeyException

getValues

<T> java.util.List<T> getValues(java.lang.String optionIdentifier,
                                java.lang.Class<T> returnType)
                            throws NoValueExeption,
                                   OptionNotSetException
Retrieve value(s) for given program option.

Type Parameters:
T - Runtime type of value.
Parameters:
optionIdentifier - String key, that is associated to requested option.
returnType - Class representation of runtime type of value.
Returns:
A list of values, associated to this option.
Throws:
NoValueExeption - if Option for optionIdentifier has no values.
OptionNotSetException - if Option was not found on command line.
See Also:
AbstractOption

getValues

<T> java.util.List<T> getValues(char optionIdentifier,
                                java.lang.Class<T> returnType)
                            throws NoValueExeption,
                                   OptionNotSetException
Retrieve value(s) for given program option.

Type Parameters:
T - Runtime type of value.
Parameters:
optionIdentifier - Character key, that is associated to requested option.
returnType - Class representation of runtime type of value.
Returns:
A list of values, associated to this option.
Throws:
NoValueExeption - if Option for optionIdentifier has no values.
OptionNotSetException - if Option was not found on command line.
See Also:
AbstractOption

isSet

boolean isSet(java.lang.String optionIdentifier)
Parameters:
optionIdentifier - String key, that is associated to requested option.
Returns:
true, if requested option is set. Otherwise false.

isSet

boolean isSet(char optionIdentifier)
Parameters:
optionIdentifier - Character key, that is associated to requested option.
Returns:
true, if requested option is set. Otherwise false.
